awd_abstract_narration: 9317710  Bromwich  This award will support a workshop at Ohio State University that  will be concerned with formulating the response of the U.S.  antarctic meteorology community to the First Regional Observing  System Test (FROST), which is an initiative of the international  Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research (SCAR) Working Group on  Physics and Chemistry of the Atmosphere.    The scientific goal of FROST is to collect all available antarctic  weather observations from standard and non-standard platforms  during three month-long special observation periods in order to  test the performance of forecasting models in antarctic latitudes  (i.e. south of 50 deg S).  Participating forecast centers include  the U.S. National Meteorological Center, the Australian Bureau of  Meteorology, the European Centre for Medium-Range Forecasting, and  the British Meteorological Office.  ***
